body_html:
Thank you for reopening this @MlWoo.

In general it's ok to use MKL and derivatives if they are available. However, we need to also leave the option of providing a correct implementation to users who do not have access to it, since we can't expect OSS users to have MKL. So, as long as you can detect whether it's available or not and default to the current implementation if it's not, this would be good to have. Do you also expect there to be a speed-up on an AMD CPU? Otherwise we might need to check for that as well.
